summary: Hydrogen is a chemical element with the symbol H and atomic number 1. It's the lightest element and is usually a gas made of two hydrogen atoms (Hâ‚‚). It's colorless, odorless, and very flammable. Hydrogen is the most common element in the universe, found in stars and many compounds on Earth. It's crucial for life, as it's a part of water and many living things. Hydrogen can be made in different ways, like from natural gas or by splitting water using electricity. It has many uses, such as in fuel cells for clean energy and in making chemicals like ammonia.
title: Hydrogen
